text: Theodore I of Corsica (25 August 1694 â€“ 11 December 1756), born Freiherr Theodor Stephan von Neuhoff, was a German adventurer who was briefly King of Corsica. Theodore is the subject of an opera by Giovanni Paisiello, Il re Teodoro in Venezia (1784, Vienna), and one of the six kings in Venice in Voltaire's Theodore has a son Colonel Frederick who is the Head of House von Neuhoff. title: Teodoru di Neuhoff
